page.title: 20WILLIAM LINKSTED/AYLESFORD
page.content: An Aylesford resident for 71yrs he has lived in 4 houses all within 200yds.A Carpenter & Joiner he worked on local buildings.Strong memories of the war include preparations to mine the roads & bridge should invasion have occured,incendiary bombs & damage to buildings but no deaths.Bill started at St Peters School in 1914,stayed until he was 14 & helped in building renovations.Though 75 he rides a moped & leads an active life.He is church verger & works hard in that service.He remembers when children were evacuated during the war the church choir was ruined.In 1929 church bells were not rung so the local scouts took over the duties.Nowadays the church is kept locked because candlesticks,Armour & as cash were stolen & vandalism occurs.
